page.title: 07FORESTRY MANAGEMENT
page.content: A backward glance over the past decade highlights the vast growth of the forestry industry in south western Scotland and particularly Eskdalemuir. Its intrusion "sounded the death-knell of many hill farms with darkened landscapes and abandoned houses derelict in an ocean of trees." This gloomy picture of a sheep farming region turned forest has been considerably lightened by the knowledgeable management of the Economic Forestry Group of large investments of private companies and individuals in some 15000 hectares of poor hill terrain. The area was considered ideal for good growth of Silka Spruce ,about 80% of the trees being of this type.The majority of plantations are fertilised by aircraft to this end Eskdalemuir has a small airstrip.
